files.name: .coveragerc
files.content:
[run]
omit =
    pyecharts/render/templates/*
    setup.py
    install.py
    test.py
    test/*

[report]
show_missing = True
omit =
    pyecharts/render/templates/*
    setup.py
    install.py

files.name: .gitignore
files.content:
# Byte-compiled / optimized / DLL files
__pycache__/
*.py[cod]
*$py.class

# C extensions
*.so
.idea
# Distribution / packaging
.Python
test/*.html
env/
build/
develop-eggs/
dist/
downloads/
eggs/
.eggs/
lib/
lib64/
parts/
sdist/
var/
*.egg-info/
.installed.cfg
*.egg

# PyInstaller
#  Usually these files are written by a python script from a template
#  before PyInstaller builds the exe, so as to inject date/other infos into it.
*.manifest
*.spec

# Installer logs
pip-log.txt
pip-delete-this-directory.txt

# Unit test / coverage reports
htmlcov/
.tox/
.coverage
.coverage.*
.cache
nosetests.xml
coverage.xml
*,cover
.hypothesis/

# Translations
*.mo
*.pot

# Django stuff:
*.log
local_settings.py

# Flask stuff:
instance/
.webassets-cache

# Scrapy stuff:
.scrapy

# Sphinx documentation
docs/_build/

# PyBuilder
target/

# IPython Notebook
.ipynb_checkpoints

# pyenv
.python-version

# celery beat schedule file
celerybeat-schedule

# dotenv
.env

# virtualenv
venv/
ENV/

# Spyder project settings
.spyderproject

# Rope project settings
.ropeproject
*~

# for mac
.DS_store

# for vscode
.vscode/

# example
example/*.png
example/*.html

# mypy
.mypy_cache/

files.name: MANIFEST.in
files.content:
include pyecharts/datasets/*.json
include pyecharts/render/templates/*
include README.md
include changelog.md

files.name: README.en.md
files.content:
pyecharts

Python â¤ï¸ ECharts = pyecharts

## ğŸ“£ Introduction [Apache ECharts](https://github.com/apache/echarts) is easy-to-use, highly interactive and highly performant javascript visualization library under Apache license. Since its first public release in 2013, it now dominates over 74% of Chinese web front-end market. Yet Python is an expressive language and is loved by data science community. Combining the strength of both technologies, [pyecharts](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts) is born. ## âœ¨ Feature highlights * Simple API, Sleek and method chaining * Support 30 + popular charts * Support data science tools: Jupyter Notebook, JupyterLab, nteract, [marimo](https://github.com/marimo-team/marimo) * Integrate with Flaskï¼ŒDjango at ease * Easy to use and highly configurable * Detailed documentation and examples. * More than 400+ geomaps assets for geograpic information processing ## â³ Version v0.5.x is not compatible with V1, which is a completely new version, see [ISSUE#892](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts/issues/892), [ISSUE#1033](https://github.com/pyecharts/). pyecharts/issues/1033). ### V0.5.x > Support for Python 2.7, 3.4+ At the discretion of the development team, version 0.5.x will no longer be maintained. Version 0.5.x code is located in the *05x* branch and documentation is located at [05x-docs.pyecharts.org](http://05x-docs.pyecharts.org). ### V1 > Python 3.7+ only The new version series will start with v1.0.0, documented at [pyecharts.org](https://pyecharts.org); examples at [gallery.pyecharts.org](https://gallery.pyecharts.org) ### V2 > Python 3.7+ only The new version is based on Echarts 5.4.1+ for rendering, and the documentation and examples are in the same location as V1. ## ğŸ”° Installation **pip install** ```shell $ pip install pyecharts ``` **Install from source** ```shell $ git clone https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts.git $ cd pyecharts $ pip install -r requirements.txt $ python setup.py install ``` ## ğŸ“ Usage ### Local computer #### HTML ```python from pyecharts.charts import Bar from pyecharts import options as opts bar = ( Bar() .add_xaxis(["è¡¬è¡«", "æ¯›è¡£", "é¢†å¸¦", "è£¤å­", "é£è¡£", "é«˜è·Ÿé‹", "è¢œå­"]) .add_yaxis("å•†å®¶A", [114, 55, 27, 101, 125, 27, 105]) .add_yaxis("å•†å®¶B", [57, 134, 137, 129, 145, 60, 49]) .set_global_opts(title_opts=opts.TitleOpts(title="æŸå•†åœºé”€å”®æƒ…å†µ")) ) bar.render() ```

#### image ```python from pyecharts.render import make_snapshot # needs to configure selenium make_snapshot(bar.render(), "bar.png") ```

### Notebook #### Jupyter Notebook ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19553554/55270255-b3d46c00-52d7-11e9-8aa5-f7b3819a1e88.png) #### JupyterLab ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19553554/55270259-c0f15b00-52d7-11e9-8811-93bfca1cc027.png) #### Web framework ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19553554/35081158-3faa7c34-fc4d-11e7-80c9-2de79371374f.gif) ## ğŸ”– Demo
For more documentation, please visit * [Chinese documentation](https://pyecharts.org/#/zh-cn/) * [English Documentation](https://pyecharts.org/#/en-us/) * [Example Documentation](https://gallery.pyecharts.org/) ## â› Software development ### Unit tests ```shell $ pip install -r test/requirements.txt $ make ``` ### Team development [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/) and [AppVeyor](https://ci.appveyor.com/) is place for continuous integration. ### Coding styles [flake8](http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/index.html), [Codecov](https://codecov.io/) and [pylint](https://www.pylint.org/) are used ## ğŸ˜‰ Author pyecharts are co-maintained by: * [@chenjiandongx](https://github.com/chenjiandongx) * [@chfw](https://github.com/chfw) * [@kinegratii](https://github.com/kinegratii) * [@sunhailin-Leo](https://github.com/sunhailin-Leo) For more contributors, please visit [pyecharts/graphs/contributors](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts/graphs/contributors) ## ğŸ’Œ Donation To develop and maintain pyecharts, it took me a lot of overnights. If you think pyecharts has helped you, please consider buying me a coffee: ã€€ã€€ã€€ Please also buy the other maintainer a coffee if you think their work helped you too [donation details](http://pyecharts.org/#/zh-cn/donate) ## ğŸ“ƒ License MIT [Â©chenjiandongx](https://github.com/chenjiandongx)

files.name: README.md
files.content:
pyecharts

Python â¤ï¸ ECharts = pyecharts

[English README](README.en.md) ## ğŸ“£ ç®€ä»‹ [Apache ECharts](https://github.com/apache/echarts) æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªç”±ç™¾åº¦å¼€æºçš„æ•°æ®å¯è§†åŒ–ï¼Œå‡­å€Ÿç€è‰¯å¥½çš„äº¤äº’æ€§ï¼Œç²¾å·§çš„å›¾è¡¨è®¾è®¡ï¼Œå¾—åˆ°äº†ä¼—å¤šå¼€å‘è€…çš„è®¤å¯ã€‚è€Œ Python æ˜¯ä¸€é—¨å¯Œæœ‰è¡¨è¾¾åŠ›çš„è¯­è¨€ï¼Œå¾ˆé€‚åˆç”¨äºæ•°æ®å¤„ç†ã€‚å½“æ•°æ®åˆ†æé‡ä¸Šæ•°æ®å¯è§†åŒ–æ—¶ï¼Œ[pyecharts](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts) è¯ç”Ÿäº†ã€‚ ## âœ¨ ç‰¹æ€§ * ç®€æ´çš„ API è®¾è®¡ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨å¦‚ä¸æ»‘èˆ¬æµç•…ï¼Œæ”¯æŒé“¾å¼è°ƒç”¨ * å›Šæ‹¬äº† 30+ ç§å¸¸è§å›¾è¡¨ï¼Œåº”æœ‰å°½æœ‰ * æ”¯æŒä¸»æµ Notebook ç¯å¢ƒï¼ŒJupyter Notebookã€JupyterLab å’Œ [marimo](https://github.com/marimo-team/marimo) * å¯è½»æ¾é›†æˆè‡³ Flaskï¼ŒSanicï¼ŒDjango ç­‰ä¸»æµ Web æ¡†æ¶ * é«˜åº¦çµæ´»çš„é…ç½®é¡¹ï¼Œå¯è½»æ¾æ­é…å‡ºç²¾ç¾çš„å›¾è¡¨ * è¯¦ç»†çš„æ–‡æ¡£å’Œç¤ºä¾‹ï¼Œå¸®åŠ©å¼€å‘è€…æ›´å¿«çš„ä¸Šæ‰‹é¡¹ç›® * å¤šè¾¾ 400+ åœ°å›¾æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”æ”¯æŒåŸç”Ÿç™¾åº¦åœ°å›¾ï¼Œä¸ºåœ°ç†æ•°æ®å¯è§†åŒ–æä¾›å¼ºæœ‰åŠ›çš„æ”¯æŒ ## â³ ç‰ˆæœ¬ v0.5.x å’Œ V1 é—´ä¸å…¼å®¹ï¼ŒV1 æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå…¨æ–°çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œè¯¦è§ [ISSUE#892](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts/issues/892)ï¼Œ[ISSUE#1033](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts/issues/1033)ã€‚ ### V0.5.x > æ”¯æŒ Python 2.7ï¼Œ3.4+ ç»å¼€å‘å›¢é˜Ÿå†³å®šï¼Œ0.5.x ç‰ˆæœ¬å°†ä¸å†è¿›è¡Œç»´æŠ¤ï¼Œ0.5.x ç‰ˆæœ¬ä»£ç ä½äº *05x* åˆ†æ”¯ï¼Œæ–‡æ¡£ä½äº [05x-docs.pyecharts.org](http://05x-docs.pyecharts.org)ã€‚ ### V1 > ä»…æ”¯æŒ Python 3.7+ æ–°ç‰ˆæœ¬ç³»åˆ—å°†ä» v1.0.0 å¼€å§‹ï¼Œæ–‡æ¡£ä½äº [pyecharts.org](https://pyecharts.org)ï¼›ç¤ºä¾‹ä½äº [gallery.pyecharts.org](https://gallery.pyecharts.org) ### V2 > ä»…æ”¯æŒ Python 3.7+ æ–°ç‰ˆæœ¬åŸºäº Echarts 5.4.1+ è¿›è¡Œæ¸²æŸ“, æ–‡æ¡£å’Œç¤ºä¾‹ä½ç½®ä¸ V1 ç›¸åŒ ## ğŸ”° å®‰è£… **pip å®‰è£…** ```shell # å®‰è£… v1 ä»¥ä¸Šç‰ˆæœ¬ $ pip install pyecharts -U # å¦‚æœéœ€è¦å®‰è£… 0.5.11 ç‰ˆæœ¬çš„å¼€å‘è€…ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ # pip install pyecharts==0.5.11 ``` **æºç å®‰è£…** ```shell # å®‰è£… v1 ä»¥ä¸Šç‰ˆæœ¬ $ git clone https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts.git # å¦‚æœéœ€è¦å®‰è£… 0.5.11 ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œè¯·ä½¿ç”¨ git clone https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts.git -b v05x $ cd pyecharts $ pip install -r requirements.txt $ python setup.py install ``` ## ğŸ“ ä½¿ç”¨ ### æœ¬åœ°ç¯å¢ƒ #### ç”Ÿæˆ HTML ```python from pyecharts.charts import Bar from pyecharts import options as opts # V1 ç‰ˆæœ¬å¼€å§‹æ”¯æŒé“¾å¼è°ƒç”¨ bar = ( Bar() .add_xaxis(["è¡¬è¡«", "æ¯›è¡£", "é¢†å¸¦", "è£¤å­", "é£è¡£", "é«˜è·Ÿé‹", "è¢œå­"]) .add_yaxis("å•†å®¶A", [114, 55, 27, 101, 125, 27, 105]) .add_yaxis("å•†å®¶B", [57, 134, 137, 129, 145, 60, 49]) .set_global_opts(title_opts=opts.TitleOpts(title="æŸå•†åœºé”€å”®æƒ…å†µ")) ) bar.render() # ä¸ä¹ æƒ¯é“¾å¼è°ƒç”¨çš„å¼€å‘è€…ä¾æ—§å¯ä»¥å•ç‹¬è°ƒç”¨æ–¹æ³• bar = Bar() bar.add_xaxis(["è¡¬è¡«", "æ¯›è¡£", "é¢†å¸¦", "è£¤å­", "é£è¡£", "é«˜è·Ÿé‹", "è¢œå­"]) bar.add_yaxis("å•†å®¶A", [114, 55, 27, 101, 125, 27, 105]) bar.add_yaxis("å•†å®¶B", [57, 134, 137, 129, 145, 60, 49]) bar.set_global_opts(title_opts=opts.TitleOpts(title="æŸå•†åœºé”€å”®æƒ…å†µ")) bar.render() ```

#### ç”Ÿæˆå›¾ç‰‡ ```python from snapshot_selenium import snapshot as driver from pyecharts import options as opts from pyecharts.charts import Bar from pyecharts.render import make_snapshot def bar_chart() -> Bar: c = ( Bar() .add_xaxis(["è¡¬è¡«", "æ¯›è¡£", "é¢†å¸¦", "è£¤å­", "é£è¡£", "é«˜è·Ÿé‹", "è¢œå­"]) .add_yaxis("å•†å®¶A", [114, 55, 27, 101, 125, 27, 105]) .add_yaxis("å•†å®¶B", [57, 134, 137, 129, 145, 60, 49]) .reversal_axis() .set_series_opts(label_opts=opts.LabelOpts(position="right")) .set_global_opts(title_opts=opts.TitleOpts(title="Bar-æµ‹è¯•æ¸²æŸ“å›¾ç‰‡")) ) return c # éœ€è¦å®‰è£… snapshot-selenium æˆ–è€… snapshot-phantomjs make_snapshot(driver, bar_chart().render(), "bar.png") ```

### Notebook ç¯å¢ƒ #### Jupyter Notebook ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19553554/55270255-b3d46c00-52d7-11e9-8aa5-f7b3819a1e88.png) #### JupyterLab ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19553554/55270259-c0f15b00-52d7-11e9-8811-93bfca1cc027.png) #### Web æ¡†æ¶ ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19553554/35081158-3faa7c34-fc4d-11e7-80c9-2de79371374f.gif) ## ğŸ”– Demo > Demo ä»£ç ä½äº example æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ä¸‹ï¼Œæ¬¢è¿å‚è€ƒ pyecharts ç”»å»Š [pyecharts-gallery](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts-gallery)ã€‚
æ›´å¤šè¯¦ç»†æ–‡æ¡£ï¼Œè¯·è®¿é—® * [ä¸­æ–‡æ–‡æ¡£](http://pyecharts.org/#/zh-cn/) * [English Documentation](http://pyecharts.org/#/en-us/) * [ç¤ºä¾‹ Example](https://gallery.pyecharts.org) ## â› ä»£ç è´¨é‡ ### å•å…ƒæµ‹è¯• ```shell $ pip install -r test/requirements.txt $ make ``` ### é›†æˆæµ‹è¯• ä½¿ç”¨ [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/) å’Œ [AppVeyor](https://ci.appveyor.com/) æŒç»­é›†æˆç¯å¢ƒã€‚ ### ä»£ç è§„èŒƒ ä½¿ç”¨ [flake8](http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/index.html), [Codecov](https://codecov.io/) ä»¥åŠ [pylint](https://www.pylint.org/) æå‡ä»£ç è´¨é‡ã€‚ ## ğŸ˜‰ Author pyecharts ä¸»è¦ç”±ä»¥ä¸‹å‡ ä½å¼€å‘è€…å¼€å‘ç»´æŠ¤ * [@chenjiandongx](https://github.com/chenjiandongx) * [@chfw](https://github.com/chfw) * [@kinegratii](https://github.com/kinegratii) * [@sunhailin-Leo](https://github.com/sunhailin-Leo) æ›´å¤šè´¡çŒ®è€…ä¿¡æ¯å¯ä»¥è®¿é—® [pyecharts/graphs/contributors](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts/graphs/contributors) ## ğŸ’¡ è´¡çŒ® æœŸå¾…èƒ½æœ‰æ›´å¤šçš„å¼€å‘è€…å‚ä¸åˆ° pyecharts çš„å¼€å‘ä¸­æ¥ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¼šä¿è¯å°½å¿« Reivew PR å¹¶ä¸”åŠæ—¶å›å¤ã€‚ä½†æäº¤ PR è¯·ç¡®ä¿ 1. é€šè¿‡æ‰€æœ‰å•å…ƒæµ‹è¯•ï¼Œå¦‚è‹¥æ˜¯æ–°åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè¯·ä¸ºå…¶æ–°å¢å•å…ƒæµ‹è¯• 2. éµå®ˆå¼€å‘è§„èŒƒï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ black ä»¥åŠ isort æ ¼å¼åŒ–ä»£ç ï¼ˆ$ pip install -r requirements-dev.txtï¼‰ 3. å¦‚è‹¥éœ€è¦ï¼Œè¯·æ›´æ–°ç›¸å¯¹åº”çš„æ–‡æ¡£ æˆ‘ä»¬ä¹Ÿéå¸¸æ¬¢è¿å¼€å‘è€…èƒ½ä¸º pyecharts æä¾›æ›´å¤šçš„ç¤ºä¾‹ï¼Œå…±åŒæ¥å®Œå–„æ–‡æ¡£ï¼Œæ–‡æ¡£é¡¹ç›®ä½äº [pyecharts/website](https://github.com/pyecharts/website) ## ğŸ“ƒ License MIT [Â©chenjiandongx](https://github.com/chenjiandongx)

files.name: install.py
files.content:
import os

here = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__))
about = {}
with open(os.path.join(here, "pyecharts", "_version.py")) as f:
    exec(f.read(), about)

UNINSTALL = "{} uninstall pyecharts -y"
INSTALL = "{} install -U dist/pyecharts-{}-py3-none-any.whl --no-cache-dir"

os.system("python setup.py bdist_wheel")
os.system(UNINSTALL.format("pip"))
os.system(UNINSTALL.format("pip3"))
os.system(INSTALL.format("pip", about["__version__"]))
os.system(INSTALL.format("pip3", about["__version__"]))

files.name: setup.py
files.content:
import os
import sys
from shutil import rmtree

from setuptools import Command, find_packages, setup

# RELEASE STEPS
# $ python setup.py upload


__title__ = "pyecharts"
__description__ = "Python options, make charting easier"
__url__ = "https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts"
__author_email__ = "chenjiandongx@qq.com"
__license__ = "MIT"

__requires__ = ["jinja2", "prettytable", "simplejson"]
__extra_requires__ = {
    "selenium": ["snapshot-selenium"],
    "phantomjs": ["snapshot-phantomjs"],
    "pyppeteer": ["snapshot-pyppeteer"],
    "images": ["PIL"],
}

__keywords__ = ["Echarts", "charts", "plotting-tool"]
# Load the package's _version.py module as a dictionary.
here = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__))
about = {}
with open(os.path.join(here, __title__, "_version.py")) as f:
    exec(f.read(), about)


__version__ = about["__version__"]


class UploadCommand(Command):
    description = "Build and publish the package."
    user_options = []

    @staticmethod
    def status(s):
        print("âœ¨âœ¨ {0}".format(s))

    def initialize_options(self):
        pass

    def finalize_options(self):
        pass

    def run(self):
        try:
            self.status("Removing previous buildsâ€¦")
            rmtree(os.path.join(here, "dist"))
            rmtree(os.path.join(here, "build"))
            rmtree(os.path.join(here, "{0}.egg-info".format(__title__)))
        except OSError:
            pass

        self.status("Building Source and Wheel distributionâ€¦")
        os.system("{0} setup.py sdist bdist_wheel".format(sys.executable))

        self.status("Uploading the package to PyPI via Twineâ€¦")
        os.system("twine upload dist/*")

        self.status("Pushing git tagsâ€¦")
        os.system('git tag -a v{0} -m "release version v{0}"'.format(__version__))
        os.system("git push origin v{0}".format(__version__))

        sys.exit()


setup(
    name=__title__,
    version=__version__,
    description=__description__,
    url=__url__,
    author=about["__author__"],
    author_email=__author_email__,
    license=__license__,
    packages=find_packages(exclude=("test",)),
    keywords=__keywords__,
    install_requires=__requires__,
    zip_safe=False,
    include_package_data=True,
    classifiers=[
        "Development Status :: 5 - Production/Stable",
        "Environment :: Console",
        "Intended Audience :: Developers",
        "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
        "Operating System :: OS Independent",
        "Programming Language :: Python",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.6",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.7",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.8",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.9",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.10",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
        "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
        "Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries",
    ],
    cmdclass={"upload": UploadCommand},
    extras_require=__extra_requires__,
)

files.name: test.py
files.content:
import os

# nose2
os.system(
    "nose2 --with-coverage --coverage pyecharts "
    "--coverage-config .coveragerc -s test"
)

# pytest
os.system("pytest -cov-config=.coveragerc --cov=./ test/")

# flake8 for code linting
os.system("flake8 --exclude=build,example,images --max-line-length=89 --ignore=F401")
